page.title: 08BUILDINGS
page.content: The buildings of Southborough,High Brooms and surrounding area reflect the growth of the town and local building materials,oak,brick and sandstone. The earliest houses in the area were built of oak, but few examples still survive.The fine local clay meant that brick was used for the 19th century buildings in Southborough. The building before 1914 was haphazard: some terraced housing and some large villas which are now mostly demolished or divided into flats. An interesting local feature is the use of bricks or setts for paving. They are characteristic of the area and are regrettably being removed and replaced by tarmac.It is also unfortunate that many brick houses are being painted white and the slate roofs being replaced by modern tiles.
